content: Domnívám se, že thunderbird sám o sobě sdílení kalendářů, aby se kalendáře průběžně synchronizovaly a ostatní uživatelé mohli přidávat události, nepodporuje. Doporučuji založit kalendář u Googlu, Microsoftu, seznam.cz, ... a ten s ostatními sdílet. Tento sdílený online kalendář si pak můžete do thunderbirdu normálně přidat.

content: Have you contacted Abusix? This is not something that Thunderbird is involved in. There is a contact page for Abusix at https://abusix.com/contact-abusix-support-sales/ I suggest starting there, or contacting your email provider.

content: If it works on some PCs, but not on other, my guess is that the setting in Windows for default email client needs to be set. Check the Default Apps module in Windows and verify there which program is the default email application.
creator: davidsk

content: Hi David, No that is not the answer. As I said in my post, the default has been set to Thunderbird in all the machines. I am wondering if there is another setting somewhere. I did read that you need to be tunning 32 bit version of Thunderbird, and indeed the Thunderbird version on my machine is 32 bit, but installing 32 bit on the other machines hasn't helped.

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

As I am happy with thunderbird and now think the best way forward is for my wife to also use thunderbird. I still have the email as set up originally with plusnet using julian@lionel33.... but remains the same but comes into my pc and I open up thunderbird, but my wife has helen@lionel33..... but has to go to webmail with plusnet and difficult to logon. If helen can be added to the thunderbird as a new addition that would be great.
creator: julian51

content: You can set her up with an accout on your PC or hers. You can get the setup information by clicking 'account settings' on your pc and copying the information from the 'server settings' pane and also from the SMTP server settings pane (which you can get from the 'account settings' pane and scrolling down left side to 'Outgoing server SMTP' and copying that information. Then, using her email address you will have all the necessary information. Be sure to note whether you are using POP or IMAP so you can set hers up the same.
creator: davidsk

content: Please provide more information. Is this a Gmail account? If so, remember that all inboxes are subsets of Allmail (which often causes confusion).

content:
Here are steps:

here is the info in brief steps:

BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there

This does NOT mean that all IMAP messages are backed up because you may have only headers on PC. Not an issue, since IMAP files auto populate on restores.
creator: davidsk
